channel.title: Looking for a new laptop
channel.description:
http://www.bizrate.com/laptopcomputers/ibm-thinkpad-600-300-mhz-pentium-ii-laptop--pid5208627/
[img]http://image.bizrate.com/resize?sq=100&uid=5208627[/img]
This one looks pretty good, i'm considering it.
Details A 'portable' computer shouldn't make you lean to the side as you carry it. But you shouldn't have to sacrifice computing power for portability, either. The solution? IBM's ThinkPad 600 series, which offers fast processing, large color displays and top-notch multimedia features in a notebook weighing only five pounds. This ThinkPad 600 contains a [b]screaming fast mobile Pentium II processor[/b]. There's not a notebook application, business or multimedia, that this CPU can't handle with fluid ease. You might end up with a notebook that outperforms your office desktop system! Large amount of integrated L2 cache will keep the Pentium II running at peak performance. Your notebook's life expectancy might be lowered if it doesn't have sufficient room for memory expansion. The notebook's hard drive is large enough that you won't run short of storage space for a long time to come. Its active matrix color display that graces this ThinkPad is suitable not only for doing your own work, but for making multimedia presentations to others as well. Get more power with less bulk. Find out the meaning of 'mobile computing' with the IBM ThinkPad 600.
I have 2 laptops and 3 desktops, needs moar jiggawatts so I can calculate pi faster.
Okay I was joking about that I only have one desktop and one server.

item.title: Looking for a new laptop
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

How much are you going to pay for that? I’d pay someone to take it off me if I had one. Look at it.

Brand: IBM Operating System Compatibility: PC Operating System: (what's this?) Windows 98 Recommended Usage: Basic/ Home Average Battery Life: 3 Hrs Processor Manufacturer: Intel Processor Type: (what's this?) Pentium II Processor Speed: (what's this?) 300 MHz Bus Speed: (what's this?) 66 MHz Level 2 Cache: (what's this?) 512 KB Motherboard Chipset: (what's this?) Intel 440BX Hard Drive Capacity: 5.1 GB Hard Drive Interface Type: (what's this?) IDE / EIDE Hard Drive Type: Portable Floppy Drive Type: 3.5" HD Memory Card Slot: (what's this?) Card Bus Installed Memory: (what's this?) 64 MB RAM Type: (what's this?) SDRAM Maximum Supported RAM: (what's this?) 288 MB Optical Drive Type: CD-ROM, CD+RW CD Read Speed: 24 X Diagonal Screen Size: (what's this?) 13.3 in Color Resolution: (what's this?) 24-Bit Video Resolution Standard: (what's this?) VGA, XGA Maximum Resolution: (what's this?) 1024 x 768 Pixels Video Card Memory: 2 MB Maximum Video Memory: 2 MB Networking Connection Type: (what's this?) Wireless LAN Modem Speed: 56 KBps

Funny joke at the end. I’m killing myself laughing.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a new laptop

Bizrate

Laptop Computers | Bizrate

Items 1 - 40 of 200. Save money on Laptop Computers like the StarTech.com 12U 19in Hinged Wall Mount Server Rack Cabinet w/ Steel Mesh Door Wall mount cabinet.

This one looks pretty good, i’m considering it.

Details
A ‘portable’ computer shouldn’t make you lean to the side as you carry it. But you shouldn’t have to sacrifice computing power for portability, either. The solution? IBM’s ThinkPad 600 series, which offers fast processing, large color displays and top-notch multimedia features in a notebook weighing only five pounds. This ThinkPad 600 contains a screaming fast mobile Pentium II processor. There’s not a notebook application, business or multimedia, that this CPU can’t handle with fluid ease. You might end up with a notebook that outperforms your office desktop system! Large amount of integrated L2 cache will keep the Pentium II running at peak performance. Your notebook’s life expectancy might be lowered if it doesn’t have sufficient room for memory expansion. The notebook’s hard drive is large enough that you won’t run short of storage space for a long time to come. Its active matrix color display that graces this ThinkPad is suitable not only for doing your own work, but for making multimedia presentations to others as well. Get more power with less bulk. Find out the meaning of ‘mobile computing’ with the IBM ThinkPad 600.
